speaker: Constable
text_entry: SCENE III. The English camp.

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, BEDFORD, EXETER, ERPINGHAM, with all his host: SALISBURY and WESTMORELAND

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Where is the king?

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: The king himself is rode to view their battle.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Of fighting men they have full three score thousand.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: There's five to one; besides, they all are fresh.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: God's arm strike with us! 'tis a fearful odds.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: God be wi' you, princes all; I'll to my charge:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: If we no more meet till we meet in heaven,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Then, joyfully, my noble Lord of Bedford,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: My dear Lord Gloucester, and my good Lord Exeter,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And my kind kinsman, warriors all, adieu!

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: Farewell, good Salisbury; and good luck go with thee!

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Farewell, kind lord; fight valiantly to-day:

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: And yet I do thee wrong to mind thee of it,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: For thou art framed of the firm truth of valour.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Exit SALISBURY

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: He is full of valour as of kindness;

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: Princely in both.

speaker: BEDFORD
text_entry: Enter the KING

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: O that we now had here

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: But one ten thousand of those men in England

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: That do no work to-day!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What's he that wishes so?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: My cousin Westmoreland? No, my fair cousin:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: If we are mark'd to die, we are enow

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: To do our country loss; and if to live,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The fewer men, the greater share of honour.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: God's will! I pray thee, wish not one man more.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: By Jove, I am not covetous for gold,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Nor care I who doth feed upon my cost;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: It yearns me not if men my garments wear;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Such outward things dwell not in my desires:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But if it be a sin to covet honour,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I am the most offending soul alive.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: No, faith, my coz, wish not a man from England:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: God's peace! I would not lose so great an honour

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: As one man more, methinks, would share from me

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For the best hope I have. O, do not wish one more!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Rather proclaim it, Westmoreland, through my host,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That he which hath no stomach to this fight,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Let him depart; his passport shall be made

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And crowns for convoy put into his purse:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We would not die in that man's company

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That fears his fellowship to die with us.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: This day is called the feast of Crispian:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: He that outlives this day, and comes safe home,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Will stand a tip-toe when the day is named,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And rouse him at the name of Crispian.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: He that shall live this day, and see old age,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Will yearly on the vigil feast his neighbours,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And say 'To-morrow is Saint Crispian:'

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Then will he strip his sleeve and show his scars.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And say 'These wounds I had on Crispin's day.'

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Old men forget: yet all shall be forgot,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But he'll remember with advantages

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: What feats he did that day: then shall our names.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Familiar in his mouth as household words

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Harry the king, Bedford and Exeter,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Warwick and Talbot, Salisbury and Gloucester,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Be in their flowing cups freshly remember'd.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: This story shall the good man teach his son;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And Crispin Crispian shall ne'er go by,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: From this day to the ending of the world,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But we in it shall be remember'd;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We few, we happy few, we band of brothers;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: For he to-day that sheds his blood with me

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Shall be my brother; be he ne'er so vile,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: This day shall gentle his condition:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And gentlemen in England now a-bed

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Shall think themselves accursed they were not here,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And hold their manhoods cheap whiles any speaks

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That fought with us upon Saint Crispin's day.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Re-enter SALISBURY

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: My sovereign lord, bestow yourself with speed:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The French are bravely in their battles set,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And will with all expedience charge on us.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: All things are ready, if our minds be so.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Perish the man whose mind is backward now!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Thou dost not wish more help from England, coz?

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: God's will! my liege, would you and I alone,

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Without more help, could fight this royal battle!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Why, now thou hast unwish'd five thousand men;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Which likes me better than to wish us one.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: You know your places: God be with you all!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Tucket. Enter MONTJOY

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Once more I come to know of thee, King Harry,

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: If for thy ransom thou wilt now compound,

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Before thy most assured overthrow:

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: For certainly thou art so near the gulf,

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Thou needs must be englutted. Besides, in mercy,

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: The constable desires thee thou wilt mind

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Thy followers of repentance; that their souls

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: May make a peaceful and a sweet retire

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: From off these fields, where, wretches, their poor bodies

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Must lie and fester.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Who hath sent thee now?

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: The Constable of France.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I pray thee, bear my former answer back:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Bid them achieve me and then sell my bones.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Good God! why should they mock poor fellows thus?

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The man that once did sell the lion's skin

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: While the beast lived, was killed with hunting him.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: A many of our bodies shall no doubt

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Find native graves; upon the which, I trust,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Shall witness live in brass of this day's work:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And those that leave their valiant bones in France,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Dying like men, though buried in your dunghills,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: They shall be famed; for there the sun shall greet them,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And draw their honours reeking up to heaven;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Leaving their earthly parts to choke your clime,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The smell whereof shall breed a plague in France.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Mark then abounding valour in our English,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: That being dead, like to the bullet's grazing,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Break out into a second course of mischief,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Killing in relapse of mortality.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Let me speak proudly: tell the constable

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: We are but warriors for the working-day;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Our gayness and our gilt are all besmirch'd

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: With rainy marching in the painful field;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: There's not a piece of feather in our host--

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Good argument, I hope, we will not fly--

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And time hath worn us into slovenry:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: But, by the mass, our hearts are in the trim;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And my poor soldiers tell me, yet ere night

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: They'll be in fresher robes, or they will pluck

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: The gay new coats o'er the French soldiers' heads

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And turn them out of service. If they do this,--

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: As, if God please, they shall,--my ransom then

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Will soon be levied. Herald, save thou thy labour;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Come thou no more for ransom, gentle herald:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: They shall have none, I swear, but these my joints;

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Which if they have as I will leave 'em them,

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Shall yield them little, tell the constable.

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: I shall, King Harry. And so fare thee well:

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Thou never shalt hear herald any more.

speaker: MONTJOY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: I fear thou'lt once more come again for ransom.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enter YORK

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My lord, most humbly on my knee I beg

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The leading of the vaward.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Take it, brave York. Now, soldiers, march away:

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: And how thou pleasest, God, dispose the day!

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Exeunt
